member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafeWaitHandle
member.summary: Represents a wrapper class for a wait handle.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafeWaitHandle.#ctor(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An object that represents the pre-existing handle to use.
true to reliably release the handle during the finalization phase; false to prevent reliable release (not recommended).

member.name: T:System.IO.HandleInheritability
member.summary: Specifies whether the underlying handle is inheritable by child processes.

member.name: F:System.IO.HandleInheritability.Inheritable
member.summary: Specifies that the handle is inheritable by child processes.

member.name: F:System.IO.HandleInheritability.None
member.summary: Specifies that the handle is not inheritable by child processes.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.CriticalHandle
member.summary: Represents a wrapper class for handle resources.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.CriticalHandle.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified invalid handle value.
member.param: The value of an invalid handle (usually 0 or -1).
member.exception: The derived class resides in an assembly without unmanaged code access permission.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.CriticalHandle.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the .

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.CriticalHandle.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the class specifying whether to perform a normal dispose operation.
member.param: true for a normal dispose operation; false to finalize the handle.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.CriticalHandle.Finalize
member.summary: Frees all resources associated with the handle.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.CriticalHandle.handle
member.summary: Specifies the handle to be wrapped.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.InteropServices.CriticalHandle.IsClosed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the handle is closed.
member.returns: true if the handle is closed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.InteropServices.CriticalHandle.IsInvalid
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the handle value is invalid.
member.returns: true if the handle is valid; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.CriticalHandle.ReleaseHandle
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, executes the code required to free the handle.
member.returns: true if the handle is released successfully; otherwise, in the event of a catastrophic failure, false. In this case, it generates a releaseHandleFailed MDA Managed Debugging Assistant.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.CriticalHandle.SetHandle(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Sets the handle to the specified pre-existing handle.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.CriticalHandle.SetHandleAsInvalid
member.summary: Marks a handle as invalid.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle
member.summary: Represents a wrapper class for operating system handles. This class must be inherited.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle.#ctor(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified invalid handle value.
member.param: The value of an invalid handle (usually 0 or -1). Your implementation of should return true for this value.
true to reliably let release the handle during the finalization phase; otherwise, false (not recommended).
member.exception: The derived class resides in an assembly without unmanaged code access permission.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle.DangerousAddRef(System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Manually increments the reference counter on instances.
member.param: true if the reference counter was successfully incremented; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle.DangerousGetHandle
member.summary: Returns the value of the field.
member.returns: An IntPtr representing the value of the field. If the handle has been marked invalid with , this method still returns the original handle value, which can be a stale value.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle.DangerousRelease
member.summary: Manually decrements the reference counter on a instance.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the class.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the class specifying whether to perform a normal dispose operation.
member.param: true for a normal dispose operation; false to finalize the handle.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle.Finalize
member.summary: Frees all resources associated with the handle.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle.handle
member.summary: Specifies the handle to be wrapped.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle.IsClosed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the handle is closed.
member.returns: true if the handle is closed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle.IsInvalid
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the handle value is invalid.
member.returns: true if the handle value is invalid; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle.ReleaseHandle
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, executes the code required to free the handle.
member.returns: true if the handle is released successfully; otherwise, in the event of a catastrophic failure, false. In this case, it generates a releaseHandleFailed MDA Managed Debugging Assistant.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle.SetHandle(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Sets the handle to the specified pre-existing handle.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle.SetHandleAsInvalid
member.summary: Marks a handle as no longer used.

member.name: T:System.Threading.WaitHandleExtensions
member.summary: Provides convenience methods to for working with a safe handle for a wait handle.

member.name: M:System.Threading.WaitHandleExtensions.GetSafeWaitHandle(System.Threading.WaitHandle)
member.summary: Gets the safe handle for a native operating system wait handle.
member.returns: The safe wait handle that wraps the native operating system wait handle.

member.name: M:System.Threading.WaitHandleExtensions.SetSafeWaitHandle(System.Threading.WaitHandle,Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafeWaitHandle)
member.summary: Sets a safe handle for a native operating system wait handle.
member.param: A wait handle that encapsulates an operating system-specific object that waits for exclusive access to a shared resource.
The safe handle to wrap the operating system handle.
